intro: Leucas ternifolia, commonly known as slender leucas, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, clustered in whorls along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or rocky habitats.
